result.execSummary:
The defendant William H Hester Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs waived by the Court.  DNA surcharge to be paid by 12/15/22.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William H Hester Jr

records.addlTxt:
Filed by Atty. Gutierrez advising his client will stipulate to the forfeiture of the firearm.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/27/22 - Forfeit firearm and Amend JOC.**

Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for Waukesha County Sheriff Dept.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: September 9, 2022 Plea and Sentencing hearing filed by Court Reporter Samantha Brushaber.
State's Brief in Opposition to the Return of the Seized Firearm file by ADA Thompson.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:07 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing. Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant William H Hester Jr in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for William H Hester Jr.  Atty. Gutierrez advises parties are prepared to resolve the matter and provides a plea questionnaire to the court.  Court recites the offer which was attached to the plea questionnaire.  State confirms that is the offer but has no proof of completion of any of the requested programs.  Atty. Gutierrez notes he has proof of training and AODA and provides that to the State.  State confirms it has received proof of completion of AODA and firearm safety course as well as the card for conceal carry permit.  Based on that State is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing with the offer as stated by the court.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Gutierrez.


COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE or COSTS: Waived by the Court. 
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid by 12/15/2022.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

Court will HOLD OPEN the decision with respect to whether or not the firearm seized at time of arrest should be forfeited.  Court will order the State to file a written brief within 10 days; Defense will then have to file their response within 10 days after that.  Once the court receives all the briefs it will issue a decision.
State's Motion in Limine.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am. - with rotation language
Jury status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by the State requesting to adjourn the jury trial.

Jury status hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:07 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant William H Hester in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he has not been able to reach a resolution with the State and is asking the matter be set for a jury trial.  Court adjourns for jury status and jury trial.  Court confirms with counsel the trial would take 1 day.  Court advises counsel that the proposed jury instructions, motion in limine and witness lists are due no later than 48 hours before the jury status hearing.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:19 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant William H Hester in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez advises that his client needs additional time to do is AODA assessment.  Court has concerns that counsel is seeking another adjournment for the defendant to complete his AODA assessment.  Atty. Gutierrez responds, he is hopeful it will be accomplished by the next court date.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Gutierrez requests another plea and sentencing date in 30 days. Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Luis Gutierrez
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:31 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant William H Hester in court.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with the defendant he plans to proceed without counsel.  Defendant advises that he was provided an offer; and advises he has proof of the CCW class completion with him today.  Defendant provides the proof to the State.  Atty. Schmidt advises that the defendant also needs AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as well.  Court inquires if the defendant has a copy of the State's offer.  Court will have State email copy of the offer to the clerk to print off for the defendant.  Court provides the defendant with a copy of the State's offer.  Defendant has not complied with the 2nd part of the offer yet.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing in about 45 days to allow time for the defendant to complete the AODA assessment and any treatment recommendations, if any.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms with the exception of the use of a firearm at a Concealed Carry Class and the Court will allow for the defendant to possess a firearm to and from said class.

09:35 AM Defendant William H Hester in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
